text:
With following build.xml

<project name="Override" default="all">
        <target name="all">
                <path id="java.classpath">
                        <pathelement location="./first.jar"/>
                </path>
                <path id="java.classpath">
                        <pathelement location="./second.jar"/>
                </path>
        </target>
</project>

I get the message
Overriding previous definition of reference to java.classpath

This comes from org/apache/tools/ant/Project.java, line 1778 where the log level
 is set to MSG_WARN. IMHO this is inconsistent with line 434 where overriding of
properties is logged with MSG_VERBOSE. 

Suggestion: set both to MSG_VERBOSE and please also for 1.6 and above

Thanks a lot
creator: ant-user@family-seidel.de

text:
I second this - using 1.6 I have a common.xml file defining a list of related 
projects. For each specific project i override this list. It gives a lot of 
annoying messages.
creator: sagem@e-mail.dk
elainequeencastle@hotmail.com
text:
I concur.  As it stands now, if you try to place a <script 
language="beanshell" /> task in a buildfile, EVEN ONE CONTAINING NO CODE, if 
it is outside of a target (ie: global), you always get this annoying message 
for all the references that were set globally.
The same problem occurs with <script language="jython"/> on Ant 1.6.1
creator: apa3a@yahoo.com

text: *** Bug 21438 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: mbenson@apache.org

text:
The log level of this has been downgraded to VERBOSE
in ant 1.7.0.
creator: peterreilly@apache.org
